result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Bruce Reinwand was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Murder [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "A" Felony], a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: to any other sentencing

Judgment Affirmed and Cause Remanded with Directions
records.descr: Remitt./Court of Appeals dec.&order partial remand

records.addlTxt: Affirmed and Cause Remanded with Directions - For reasons as stated in the Court of Appeals Decision Dated and Filed on 10/04/18 "we affirm Reinwand's conviction for first-degree murder, but remand to the circuit court to amend the judgment of conviction to state that Reinwand was sentenced to life imprisonment
records.descr: Court of Appeals decision & order partial remand

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.
IT IS ORDERED that the parties file simultaneous letters/briefs by April 3, 2019 discussing the impact of the Reinwand case, if any, on the issues raised in the petition for review
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review shall be held in abeyance pending this court's disposition of Case No. 2017AP850-CR, State v. Reinwand (oral argument held January 18, 2019)
Acknowledgement of receipt of Petition for Review as of 11/02/18

Court of Appeals Decision Dated and Filed October 4, 2018 -  Judgment affirmed and cause remanded with directions **In its oral ruling, the circuit court pronounsed that Reinwand was sentenced to "life imprisonment".  However, the judgment of conviction provides that Reinwand is sentenced to "Lifetime Supervision".  Reinwand argues, and the State agrees, that the judgment of conviction should be corrected to accurately reflect Reinwand's sentence.  See Wis Stat 939.50(3)(a)(1983-84).  We agree as well.   The error is a clerical one and does not affect the validity of Reinwand's conviction.  Accordingly, we remand to the circuit court with directions that the judgment of conviction be amended to state that Reinwand was sentenced to life imprisonment.  **JUDGMENT OF CONVICTION HAD BEEN CORRECTED BY THE CLERK ON JULY 11, 2017 INDICATING THAT IT IS A "MANDATORY LIFE IMPRISONMENT"
records.descr: Court of Appeals decision and order remanding

records.addlTxt:
10:23 a.m. Defendant Joseph Bruce Reinwand in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jazgar. Assistant Attorney General Robert Kaiser, Jr. appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Ostrowski and Detective Forsight present. Brian Radtke, PSI writer is also present. Court questions Defendant what his issue is today.  Court informs the Defendant that this hearing will not be rescheduled and will be held today. Parties have received the PSI report from a prior burglary case.  Atty Jazgar request to withdraw as counsel. Court denies request.
10:32 a.m. court in recess.
11:21 a.m.  Court back in session. Court questions the Defendant if there are errors in the PSI report. Defendant states what he believe is incorrect in the PSI report. Court questions Defendant if he want Atty Jazgar to represent him during sentencing. Objections stated by the State and believes the Defendant hasn't stated any good reasons for withdrawal Atty Jazgar as counsel. 
BTC: Court denies withdrawal of Atty Jazgar. 
11:39 a.m. Victim Statements A.C., and R.S.
11:59 a.m. State recommendation for consecutive prison sentence.
12:17 p.m. Atty Jazgar requests the Court to consider credit of 610 days credit. Objection stated by AAG Kaiser.

BY THE COURT:****PRISON****
Mandatory Life Imprisonment, consecutive to any other sentencing.
Not entitled to credit on this case.

20 days to seek post conviction relief.
Parties keep their respective PSI reports.
Atty Jazgar request if other counsel is appointed that his respective copy will be given to the new counsel. No objections by the State. BTC: Granted
Ad Testificandum /s/ TTF 04/11/16
cc:  DA and defendant's attorney on 02/29/16 sp
Sentencing hearing at 04-22-2016 10:00 am
Juror questions/answers from Judge
State's Requested Jury Instructions and Verdict Form's

Day 5 afternoon:
1:20  p.m. Jury Trial Day 5 - afternoon:  Court is back in session.  There is another request for exhibits 5, 32, and 45 
P#5 - Copy of Address book; no objections
P# 32 - Photo - no objections by either Attorney Kaiser or Attorney Jazgar.
P#44 - Objection by the State and defense to the entire document going back to the jurors.  Court asks for clarification from each of the counsel.  BTC:  The court will not allow Exhibit #44 as both parties do not agree to the exhibit.  
Exhibit #32 and #35 will be allowed to go back as both parties agree.  
1:30 p.m.  Attorney Kaiser asks the court to add the typical language that they are to rely on their notes and collective recollections.  No objections by Attorney Jazgar.  Court prepared a note to the jury and signed by himself .  The court reporter indicated that Exhibit #35 was referred to by the Court and Court corrects that it is Exhibit #5 and not  #35.  Court asks that the defendant remain in the courtroom.  
1:36 p.m. Another request by the jury to view Exhibits #39, #17, #40 and #21.  
Objection to Exhibit #17 by the State - states its position on the record
Jazgar requests both Exhibit  #17 and #21 go back.  Attorney Jazgar states position on the record.
Court writes a note to the Jurors, Exhibits #39 and 40 were not received into evidence so they cannot be viewed and Exhibits #17 and 21 can be viewed by the jury.  

2:32 p.m.  Court is back in session.  The jurors have reached a verdict.  Court instructs the people present in the courtroom that he wants them in proper decorum.
2:37 p.m. jurors are escorted back in.  The foreperson hands the verdict to the court.  

Verdict:  Guilty of 1st degree murder
Court polls the verdict, individually and each replied yes.  The jury has been polled and all have acknowledged the verdict.
Judge offers the jurors a sincere appreciation and gratitude for their service
2:40 p.m.  Jurors are escorted out.  

Attorney Kaiser moves for judgment on the verdict.
Court enters a Judgment of Conviction based on the verdict.  
Attorney Kasier moves for revocation of bond.

Attorney Kaiser requests to move forward with sentencing.
Attorney Jazgar requests postponement of sentencing and asks for Pre-sentence investigation prepared.  


BTC:  Court Orders PSI and  revokes bond.

Sentencing is scheduled for Friday, April 22, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

PSI shall be completed by April 14, 2016 and copies sent to counsel to prepare for sentencing arguments.

Bond is ordered revoked.

2:47 p.m.  Court is adjourned.  

All exhibits are accounted for by the Clerk.

Day 5 morning:
 8:14 a.m. Jury Trial Day 5 - morning:  Parties  are ready to proceed. Alternate will be drawn and excused after closing arguments.
8:16 a.m. Juror are returned to the Courtroom.  Court informs the Jurors of the Jury Instructions. 
8:46 a.m. Closing arguments by Atty Kaiser. Exhibit P#1 and P#5 is referred to during arguments. 
9:18 a.m. Closing arguments by Atty Jazgar. Exhibit P#1 is referred to during arguments.
9:48 a.m. Atty Kaiser rebuttal. Exhibit P#32, P#19, P#17 are referred to during rebuttal.
 10:22 a.m. Juror 1165 is drawn and excused as the alternate juror. Court informs of the Jurors duites and procedures of deliberations.
10:27 a.m. The remaining 12 Jurors are removed from the Courtroom and will begin deliberations in the jury room.  
10:28 a.m. Court in recess to fix typo in Jury Instructions #1100 (1984 verbage). 
10:38 a.m. Court back in session. Corrections stated on the record. Parties are in agreement.  Court addresses exhibits. Parties not in agreement. Court will wait until Jurors requests any of them.
10:49 a.m. Court in recess
11:31 a.m. Court in session: Exhibits requested by the Jurors: 
P#8 - Gun - Court addresses concerns on the record. Atty Kaiser objects. Atty Jazgar no objection. BTC: Court will not be provided to the jurors.
P#18 - Photo right arm - Parties don't object w/note from court not to remove post it notes from exhibit. 
P#45 Transcript - BTC: The entire transcript not going just the section published to the Jurors.
All exhibits are accounted for and kept by the Clerk, except exhibit P#18 is with the jurors.
12:02 p.m. Court in recess and parties to be back by 1:00 p.m.
#P47 Thumbnail Photos of Bullet Entry
correspondence indicating Exhibit #8 returned to Portage County Sheriff's Department

Day 4 afternoon:
12:57 p.m.  Court is back in session and appearances remain the same.
Court questions counsel if there is anything they want brought up prior to the Juror's returning to the courtroom
Atty Jazgar would ask that the Court dismiss the case for the states failure to prove the guilt of the defendant; Atty Kaiser objects.
Court makes statements to the parties on the record as to why the case will not be dismissed.
BTC:  Motion to dismiss is DENIED.
Atty Jazgar would request that the "head", used as evidence,  be moved to a different location.
"Head" is provided back to the State; whether it will be moved into evidence will be discussed later. 
Court questions Atty Jazgar if his client will be testifying. 
Atty Jazgar indicates that he is not sure if his client will testify in his own defense.
1:06 p.m.  Jurors have returned to the courtroom.
1:07 p.m.  Darlene R. is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Jazgar.
1:17 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Kaiser.
1:36 p.m.  Re-direct by Atty Jazgar.
Counsel has no further questions for this witness.
Witness is excused from her subpoena.
Court sends the Juror's to the Jury Room prior to the next witness being called.
Atty Jazgar has indicated that his client has chosen not to testify on his behalf; Court questions the defendant in regards to his testimony.  Atty Jazgar indicates that he has weighed the pros/cons with his client and states that his client is not testifying and is doing this freely, knowingly and voluntarily.  
1:40 p.m.  Defense has no further witnesses.
State will be calling a rebuttal witness.
1:42 p.m.  Atty Kaiser calls Detective Josh Ostrowski as a rebuttal witness and he is informed by the Court that he is still under oath.
Direct examination by Atty Kaiser.
1:48 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Jazgar.
Counsel has nothing further for this witness and the witness is excused.
State rests.
Defense has no rebuttal.
1:49 p.m.  Court informs the Juror's that they will be sent home for the day, as counsel and the Court will go over the Jury instructions and informs them of what will happen while they are gone and what will happen on the final day of the trial.
**Juror's are informed to return tomorrow at 8:00 a.m. 
Court will do Jury Instructions on the record but will meet with counsel in chambers.
1:53 p.m.  Court is in recess while the Court and counsel discuss the Jury Instructions in chambers.
2:55 p.m.  Court is back in session.
Court and counsel will be going over the jury instructions and verdicts on the record.
No objection by counsel on the verdict forms.
Court goes through each individual jury instruction with counsel to determine if there are any objections or changes.
3:03 p.m.  Court questions the defendant in re:  jury instruction 315; defendant responds.
Counsel has no other jury instructions they would like to have read to the jurors.
Court informs counsel of the sequence of events that will occur tomorrow.
3:10 p.m.  Exhibits #101, 102 and 103 are moved into evidence by Atty Jazgar; no objections by Atty Kaiser.  Received by the Court.
Atty Jazgar makes statement to the Court that he had heard from radio and t.v. that his client was going to testify and this was inaccurate.
3:16 p.m.  Court has adjourned for the day. 
Everyone to return by 8:00 a.m.  
Clerk has accounted for all exhibits.

Day 4 morning:
8:26 a.m. Day 4 of Jury Trial: Court in session. Atty Kaiser moves to admit exhibits P#32 and  P#37 are received by the Court..  
8:45 a.m. Atty Kaiser calls expert witness, Dr. Robert Corliss, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
Exhibits P#30 and P#31 are referred to during direct exam and are received by the Court (with exhibit P#31 subject to cross)   Exhibit P#47 is marked and referred to during direct exam and received by the Court. Exhibit P#8, P#16, are referred to during 
Exhibit P#32 is published to the Jurors. Exhibit P#18 is referred to during direct exam. Exhibit P#48 -Prop Head is marked and referred to along with Exhibit P#8 - gun demonstrating position of gun to the head. Exhibits 29 & 29a are referred to during direct exam. Exhibit 29a is published to the Jurors. Exhibit P#20 is referred to during direct exam.
Exhibit P#47 - photo mark of 12 is published  Exhibit P#33 is objected to by Atty Jazgar.
10:11 a.m. Juror are removed from Courtroom. 20 min break.
Atty Jazgar objection is addressed. 
10:17 a.m. Court in recess for 15 mins.
10:32 a.m. Court in session and jurors are returned to courtroom.
10:34 a.m. Atty Kaiser continues with direct exam.
10:36 a.m. Cross exam by Atty Jazgar. Exhibit P#32 is published.
11:05 a.m. Re-direct exam by Atty Kaiser. Exhibit P#32 is published. Exhibit P#17 and P#18 are referred to during redirect.
11:14 a.m. Re-cross exam by Atty Jazgar.
11:21 a.m. Re-direct no further recross. Juror removed from the courtroom. Parties decide to break for lunch.
11:28 a.m. Juror returned to the courtroom and informed court in recess until 12:45 p.m.
#P29A Photo of Test Fire
correspondence indicating Exhibit #8 returned to Portage County Sheriff's Department

Day 3 afternoon: 
Defendant Joseph Bruce Reinwand in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jazgar. Defendant Joseph Bruce Reinwand in custody. Assistant Attorney General Robert John Kaiser appeared for the State of Wisconsin along with Detective Ostrowski and Detective Forsight.

1:05 PM Court is back on the record, day three of jury trial. Same appearances as before. Jurors are not present in the courtroom.

Attorney Jazgar requests the Coroner be allowed to return.  Court questions whether he was contacted.  Attorney Jazgar steps out to telephone the coroner.

1:07 p.m.  Court steps out of the courtroom.  Attorney Jazgar anticipates the witness (coroner) will be present at 2:30 p.m.

1:20 p.m.  Cross examination by Attorney Jazgar.  
1:22 p.m.  Witness is released from subpoena.
1:24 p.m.  Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.  Court questions the next witness' number of convictions with the attorneys.  Court reviewed the motion and had previously   Court's decision - it is a substantial period of time that has past and its a significant number of convictions so the Answer is 9 if he has been convicted.  
1:28 p.m.  Jurors are escorted back in to the court room.  1:29 p.m.  Witness is called and Clerk swears in the next witness.  Assistant Attorney General Kaiser examines the witness.  (Todd B.) 
1:42 p.m.  Cross examination by Attorney Jazgar. 
1:45 p.m.  Redirect by Assistant Attorney General Kaiser.  
1:46 p.m.  Recross by Attorney Jazgar.  
1:46 p.m.  Witness is excused from subpoena.  
1:47 p.m.  Witness is called by Assistant Attorney General Kaiser and sworn in by the clerk (T.W.)  Examination by Assistant Attorney General Kaiser.  
1:54 p.m.  Exhibit #102 is moved into evidence by Assistant Attorney General Kaiser.  Court receives the exhibit subject to cross.  Examination continues by Assistant Attorney General Kaiser.  
2:00 p.m.  Clerk marks Exhibit #46.  Referred to in examination by Assistant Attorney General Kaiser.  
2:01 p.m.  Assistant Attorney General Kaiser requests Exhibit #45 is received for purpose of publication.    
Court receives into evidence.  
2:03 p.m.  Exhibit #35 is moved for admission and publication by Assistant Attorney General Kaiser.  Court receives.  
2:05 p.m.  Exhibit is published to the jurors.  Examination continues by Assistant Attorney General Kaiser.  2:11 p.m.  Clerk marks Exhibit #46 and Assistant Attorney General Kaiser refers to in examination.  2:13 p.m.  The record reflects the witness identified the defendant.  
2:16 p.m.  Exhibit #37 is referred in examination by Assistant Attorney General Kaiser.  
2:17 p.m.  Cross examination by Attorney Jazgar.  Exhibit #102 is referred.  
2:21 p.m.  Redirect by Assistant Attorney General Kaiser.  
2:22 p.m.  Recross by Attorney Jazgar.  Witness excused from his subpoena.
2:23 p.m.  Court advises the jurors as to the rules of leaving the courthouse.  Court advises the case will end toda y at 4:15 p.m. Court takes a brief break.  Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.  
2:51 p.m.  Court is back on the record.  Clerk marks Exhibit #103
2:53 p.m.  Court informs the jurors that the defense is recalling the witness (S.R.)
2:54 p.m.  Court reminds the witness that he is still under oath from yesterday.  
Attorney Jazgar examines the witness.  Refers to Exhibit #103 in examination.  
2:56 p.m.  Cross examine by Assistant Attorney General Kaiser.  Refers to Exhibit #20 in examination.  
2:58 p.m  Exhibit #20 is received by the court without any objection.  Exhibit #103 is received without any objeciton.  Witness is excused from his subpoena.  
2:59 p.m.  Clerk swears in the witness.  Assistant Attorney General Kaiser examines the witness (Patrol Sergeant J. Ostrowski).  3:05 p.m.  Exhibit 35 is received into evidence.
3:07 p.m.  Attorney Jazgar does not cross examine the witness.  
There are no additional witnesses today.  Court advises the jurors of the status of the case.  Court reminds the jurors to not discuss the case with anyone, not members of the household, no independent research, no blogs.  
3:09 p.m.  Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.  Everyone is expected back in the courtrooom at 8:15 a.m. tomorrow.  
3:10 p.m.  Court asks the counsel be back by 8:00 a.m. if the matter needs to go back on the record and address issues prior to the jury be present.  
3:11 p.m.  Court is in recess.

All exhibits are accounted for by the Clerk.

Day 3 morning:
Defendant Joseph Bruce Reinwand in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jazgar. Defendant Joseph Bruce Reinwand in custody. Assistant Attorney General Robert John Kaiser appeared for the State of Wisconsin along with Detective Ostrowski and Detective Forsight.

8:21 AM Court is back on the record, day three of jury trial. Same appearances as before. Jurors are here and ready to be brought in.

Court addresses the parties regarding yesterday's side bar. Court apprised the attorneys that Defendant's brother was in the courtroom after testimony was taken. Court reminded individuals that if/when witnesses are released from their subpoena, that they cannot be recalled.  Atty Kaiser concurs. Atty Jagzar concurs.

Court addresses the parties regarding intake/bail hearings. All hearings were covered except for today and maybe tomorrow. 4:15 pm will be the end of testimony today in order to do bail hearings.

Atty Kaiser addresses the Court regarding exhibits. Exhibits #22 and #24 are offered and received.

Atty Jazgar addresses the Court regarding bail hearings.  Court replies.

8:27 AM Jurors return to the Courtroom.

Court welcomes Jurors back, there are still 13 Jurors. 
Court is ready to proced with the next witness.

8:29 AM Gina Boettcher is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Kaiser.
Exhibit #9 is referred to.
Exhibit #25 is referred to, is offered and received subject to cross.
Exhibit #26 is referred to, is offered and received subject to cross.
Exhibit #8 is referred to. (Detective Ostrowski presents revolver to witness).

Exhibit #8 is referred to. (Detective Ostrowski presents revolver to witness).

Exhibit #41 is marked on behalf of the Plaintiff, is offered and received.
8:45 AM Re-cross by Atty Jazgar.
Witness is excused from subpoena.

8:46 AM William Newhouse is called and sworn in.

Exhibit #27 is referred to, is offered and received.
Exhibit #28 is referred to, is offered and received subject to cross.
Exhibit #8 is referred to. (Detective Ostrowski presents revolver to witness).
Exhibit #29 is referred to.
Exhibit #29A is marked on behalf of Plaintiff, is offered and received and published.
Exhibit #8 is referred to. (Detective Ostrowski presents revolver to witness).
Exhibit #29 is offered and received, subject to cross.
9:08 AM Jurors are taken to jury room for clarification questions.
Atty Kaiser addresses the Court regarding Exhibits #28 and#29.
Court addresses the parties regarding these two exhibits.
Court questions Mr. Newhouse for clarifications on these two exhibits.
Exhibits #28 and #29 have nothing to do with each other.
Atty Jazgar addresses the Court regarding the objection, for the record.
Atty Kaiser requests a break, misunderstood and has to find the report for Exhibit #29 and see if Defense received the report as well.  Atty Jazgar replies.

9:16 AM Court takes a 20 minute morning recess at this time. Bailiff is instructed to tell Jurors that same rules apply.

9:40 AM Court is back on the record. Everyone is ready to proceed.
Atty Kaiser apologies for the delay.

9:42 AM Jurors enter the Courtroom.
Exhibit #42 is marked on behalf of the Plaintiff.

Court apologizes to the Jurors, was best to have the recess.

9:43 AM Direct examination by Atty Kaiser on Mr. Newhouse continues.
Exhibit #42 is referred to, is offered and received, subject to cross.
Exhibit #43 is marked on behalf of the Plaintiff, opened by witness. 
Exhibits #42 and #43 are offered and received, subject to cross.
Exhibit #29 and #29A are offered and received, subject to cross.
9:48 AM Cross-examination by Atty Jazgar.
Exhibit #32 is referred to.
10:09 AM Re-direct by Atty Kaiser.
Exhibit #8 is referred to. (Detective Ostrowski presents revolver to witness).
10:17 AM Re-cross by Atty Jazgar.
Witness is excused from his subpoena.

10:20 AM Randy Winkels is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Kaiser.
10:29 AM Witness is excused from his subpoena.

10:30 AM Jodi Biadiaz is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Kaiser.
10:43 AM Cross-examination by Atty Jazgar.
Exhibit #102 is marked on behalf of the Defendant.
10:51 AM Re-direct by Atty Kaiser.
Witness is excused from her subpoena.

10:52 AM Edward Lanphear is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Kaiser.
Witness identifies Defendant.
11:09 AM Cross-examination by Atty Jazgar.
11:13 AM Re-direct by Atty Kaiser.
11:14 AM Re-cross by Atty Jazgar.
Witness is excused from his subpoena.

11:17 AM Court will take a 10 minute recess, will resume at 11:30 AM. Jurors cannot leave the building this time. Court reminds Jurors of the instructions. Jurors return to Jury room.

11:28 AM Court is back on the record.
Neither party has anything to put back on the record.

Atty Jagzar requests a scheduling conference, will be conducted during mid break today.

11:29 AM Jurors return to the Courtroom.

11:30 AM Phyllis Wesener is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Kaiser.
Witness identifies Defendant.
Exhibit #34 is referred to, is offered and received and published.
Exhibit #44 is marked on behalf of Plaintiff, is offered and received, subject to cross.
Parts of Exhibit #34 are played at this time.
11:42 AM Cross-examination by Atty Jazgar.
Witness is excused from her subpoena.

11:46 AM Court will take a noon recess at this time, will resume at 1:00 pm. 
Court reminds Jurors as to not discuss the case with anyone or do any independent research.

11:47 AM Court is in recess.

All exhibits that have been referred to or offered/received have been accounted for.

Defendant Joseph Bruce Reinwand in court with attorney Jeffrey Jazgar. Defendant Joseph Bruce Reinwand in custody. Robert John Kaiser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:11 a.m.  Court calls the case and states the appearances. 

Motions before the court today: 
Issues concerning confrontation clause testimonial and non-test
Statements hearsay exceptions
Other acts evidence
Non-other acts evidence

The parties have briefed those issues thoroughly.  

Motion requesting the admission of certain statements made by Dale Meister.  Defendant is objecting. 
Atty Kaiser makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Jazgar makes arguments to the Court.
 
BY THE COURT:  
Court cannot find any statements made to lay witnesses fall under testimonial and they are found to be non-testimonial. 

Hearsay exception is now addressed: 
Atty Kaiser makes arguments to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Kaiser. 
Atty Jazgar makes arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  
Court finds Residual exceptions apply and are applicable and does not go to admissability and is admissable hearsay for the reasons stated on the record.  

Other acts evidence - Sullivan analysis:
Atty Kaiser makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Jazgar makes arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Statements made are direct evidence and already been ruled as admissible.  The conviction from Wood County is probative and admissible.  Court does not find it to be testimonial for reasons stated on the record. 
Court proceeds with Sullivan Analysis. 

Atty Jazgar questions the Court re: statements provided to the Court. 
Atty Kaiser makes statements to the Court re: supplemental notice.  

Court requests documentation be provided to him as suggested by Atty Kaiser. 
Atty Jazgar questions transcript use in re: to JD case.  
Court questions Atty Jazgar. 
Atty Jazgar responds.  
BY THE COURT:  Anyting that's marked as an exhibit, the court will need a copy.  Those can be pre-marked and copies provided to the Court prior to trial or during the proceedings. 

All motions have been addressed at this point,  anything else that comes up has to be provided 72 hours prior to the final pre-trial conference on 2/17.  
Both parties are prepared for trial as scheduled. 

Atty Kaiser indicaets he has not been provided with a copy of the defense list. 
Atty Jazgar will provide a list if there are any other witnesses that have not been listed by the state and will provide that within the next 72 hours.  
Court advises a copy is to be sent to his office as well. 

Atty Jazgar questions the Court re: how many jurors.  
Court will speak to the Jury clerk today.   Court believes 60 will be called with the intent for alternates and strikes.

Defendant Joseph Bruce Reinwand in court with attorney Jeffrey Jazgar. Defendant Joseph Bruce Reinwand in custody. Robert John Kaiser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:55 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court addresses handwritten motion to withdraw counsel made by the defendant. 
Atty Jazgar makes statements to the Court.  Met with his client in person last week.  CD's will be downloaded to paper and given to the defendant.  That way he will have complete access and not worry about computer issues.  Discussion re: audio.  Will have a discussion with the warden.  Significant amount of audio was transcribed so he will receive those as well.  It's his understanding that he will continue to represent the defendant. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant would like Atty Jazgar to continue as his counsel.  Withdraws his motion to withdraw counsel. 
BY THE COURT:  Motion is withdrawn. 

-There are a number of motions and responses to those motions. 
Court does not recall, nor does he have a copy of the change of venue or whether that was discussed on the record.  
Atty Kaiser makes statements to the Court.  Atty Biskupic filed the objection.  Neither party has filed for change of venue. 
Atty Jazgar makes statements to the Court.  They do not plan to change the venue, the most they would request is individual voir dire.  
Court indicates he will not make a ruling due to no official motion having been filed.  Matter was addressed in chambers.  Characterized as a pre-emptive strike by Atty Kaiser.  
With regard to Jury Questionnaires - there is no formal request at this point so the Court will not make a ruling on that.  Makes additional statements to the parties re: questionnaires. 

- Motion to Dismiss/Respond to State's Motion to Use Dale Meister's Statements Based on "Forfeiture By Wrongdoing"
Atty Kaiser makes statements to the Court.  Supplied a supplemental brief in support.  Stands by that supplemental brief. 
Court will not rule on this motion.  Requiring Atty Jazgar to file a brief with legal analysis as to why he thinks Jensen applies and how it applies.  To be filed by Nov. 13th, 2015.  Reply brief to be filed by Nov. 25th, 2015.  Court will either write a decision or the 2nd motion hearing is set for Jan. 2, 2016.  That would be the last date the court will have his decision. 

Court reviews the motions that were heard previously. 
Atty Jazgar indicates 14CF193, the minutes sheet reflected that a transcript could not be produced without a court order.  Asks that he be allowed to submit another order to have that transcript produced. 
Atty Kaiser does not object. 
BY THE COURT:  Granted.  Atty Jazgar to prepare the order. 
Court questions Atty Jazgar re: viewing the 14CV193.  

08CV36 was held in abayance. 
Atty Jazgar indicates that file was a restrainging order.  Re: 06PA12PF file, he viewed the file and the parties were order to mediation.  However, there was no petiion or formal motion as to how that came about.  There's no record of it.  Might have to file an additional motion for that to be produced.  They have the initial paternity and then mediation requested and ordered, but they dont have the petition or motion as to why it was ordered.  Will have contact the attorney in that file.  If he runs into problems, he will file a formal motion. 

- State's Motion to Strike Motion to Suppress Statements or in the Alternative, Deny it on its Face. 
Atty Kaiser makes arguments to the court in support of the motion. 
Atty Jazgar makes statements. 

BY THE COURT:  Court requires defense by 11/13/2015 to state with particularity which statements they want suppressed and legal basis for it.  If that is done, will be addressed at the second motion hearing set for January.  If not it will be struck or withdrawn. 

- Request to dismiss for violation of equal protection #1 and motion to dismiss for equal protection #2. 
Atty Jazgar makes arguments in support of his motions.  Asks court to take under advisement until 11/13/15. At that time, he can submit or inform if his open records request was granted or denied. 
Atty Kaiser makes arguments to the Court in opposition to the motions.  
Atty Jazgar responds. 
Court questions Atty Jazgar. 
Atty Jazgar makes statements re: what it is he is looking for w/ regards to the appointment of the special prosecutor. 
Atty Kaiser makes additional statements. 
BY THE COURT: 
Court will address the matter today,  if Atty Jazgar finds out anything from the open records that merit's a motion to reconsider, will put burden on Atty Jazgar.  
This is not a denial of equal protection.  Court denies the motion to dismiss the matter for violation of equal protection for the reasons stated on the record.  

- Motion to Inspect the Prosecutors file. 
There has been a reply/response by Atty Kaiser. 
Atty Jazgar summarizes his position on this motion. Stands by Wis. Stats. 971.23(1).  
Atty Kaiser responds and makes arguments to the Court.  
Atty Jazgar responds. 
BY THE COURT: 
Court has received written response/brief from the state.  
Court is not going to require the State to allow Atty Jazgar to have free access to the State's file in this case.  However, as Atty Kaiser has indicated, if defense wishes to view physical evidence being held by police, the State will work with counsel and police to arrange for that viewing.  Request is denied for personal inspection of the State's file.  

Court notes the DA has turned over their witness list.  There is over 100 witnesses on that list. 
Atty Jazgar acknowledges receipt of the States current witness list and has provided a copy to his client.  Makes additional statements.  

STATES MOTIONS
- Motion to Bar Evidence of the Defendant's Intoxication or Blackouts: 
Atty Jazgar makes statements to the Court.  
Atty Kaiser makes arguments in support of the motion. 
Court questions Atty Kaiser. 
Atty Kaiser responds. 
Atty Jazgar responds to the arguments made by Atty Kaiser. 
Atty Kaiser makes additional arguments to the Court. 
Court questions parties. 
BY THE COURT:  Court is not deciding whether or not the defendant is entitled to an intoxication defense.  With regards to wehter or not alcohol had been consumed by both the defendant and the victim, it is part of the facts and does not intend to do so. Counsel can move for reconsideration as the case unfolds and bring this matter up again.  Will have a better understanding of the context of the issue.  Court does not exclude it just on its face but subject to review and reconsideration. 

- Motion to Bar Psychiatric Evidence. 
Atty Kaiser makes arguments in support of the motion. 
Atty Jazgar makes arguments in opposition to the motion.  

11:08 a.m.  Court takes a brief recess. 

11:18 a.m.  Court is back in session. 
Atty Jazgar makes additional statements to the Court. 
BY THE COURT:  Court denies the motion to absolutely exclude evidence for the reasons stated on the record.  Court will make decision on relevancy at the time of trial. 

- Other Acts Evidence.
Atty Kaiser makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Jazgar makes arguments to the Court.

BY THE COURT: 
RE: Pam Reinwand does not fulfill the requirement with re: dog food incident.  The other evidence of her not driving a car or general testimony with re: to control is not being excluded.  
RE: Pam Bauer pushing incident - does not meet the requirement and is not relevant.  
RE: Gas can incident - is not relevant and will not be allowed. 

Motion to admit character evidence of Pam Reinwand. 
Atty Kaiser makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Jazgar makes arguments to the Court. 
BY THE COURT:  Motion is granted for reasons stated on the record. 
 
Court is not precluding the parties from addressing the issues once evidence is brought in. 

Atty Kaiser requests for defense witness list by 1/19/2016.  
Atty Jazgar does not object.

9:17 AM Court calls case.

Atty Kaiser and Atty Jazgar states their appearances.

Today's date is set aside for the first motion hearing date. There has been a couple of motion hearing dates set.

Court received a handwritten motion from Defendant asking for new counsel, was received August 9th, filed August 12th.
Atty Jazgar received a copy of this from the Court.
Atty Jazgar addresses the Court, does not know the Defendant's position right now.
Atty Jazgar filed a number of motions today.

Court questions Defendant.
Defendant went through the motions that his attorney filed this morning.
These motions were being filed in anticipation for September 25th, not for today.
Atty Jazgar states that a couple of the motions could be addressed today. 

Court reads the motion headings, for the record.
Court addresses the motions that are to be heard today, Atty Kaiser concurs.

-Written motion and request for new counsel is addressed first.
Defendant addresses the Court, his attorney was going to work on his request, will keep him as counsel.
Defendant is withdrawing his motion and wishes that Atty Jazgar to continue as being counsel.

Atty Jazgar addresses the Court regarding the motion for withdraw, the volume of discovery has been cumbersome and failed to disclose the significant problems with obtaining everything with his client, that is where the communication has broke down and has been resolved this morning.

Court questions Atty Jazgar regarding continuing today's hearing.

Atty Jazgar addresses the Court, replies to the issue at hand.  
There was a John Doe hearing that Judge Potter presided over in Wood County, a homicide case. There was also a John Doe in Portage County regarding this case and Judge Potter presided over that as well. 
Atty Jazgar addresses the Court, Wood County case started in 2012, 12JD-1.  Portage County also has case, 12JD-1. Atty Jazgar was aware of two different JD cases. Atty Jazgar reviewed the Wood County case. Atty Jazgar asked then to review the Portage County case. Clerk of Courts did not have the file, Judge Potter had it.  Atty Jazgar had access to the Portage County this morning.  Clerk of Courts is present right now in the courtroom.  

Atty Kaiser is willing to accept offer of proof without Clerk of Courts having to testify.

Atty Jazgar explains to the Court further why the file needs to be reviewed further, does not feel comfortable proceeding not knowing what is in there.

Atty Kaiser addresses the Court, responds, believes everything was given to Defense, including both John Does, explains how the paper material is put on a thumb drive.  6,614 pages are on the thumb drive, both cases and exhibits.

Atty Jazgar addresses the Court, responds.  
Atty Jazgar acknowledges receiving the thumb drive. 

Court clarifies.
Atty Jazgar wants to see the documents that are on the thumb drive, wants to see what is in the court file so everything is actually on the thumb drive. 
Atty Jazgar explains what he has seen on the thumb drive at this time and the incomplete paperwork that he is seeking. 

14CV-193 is addressed.

Neither party has had access to 14CV-193.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order the stipulation that has been entered.
Atty Jazgar will prepare the order for the Judge to sign.

Atty Jazgar takes a moment with his client.

-Potential Exculpatory Evidence is addressed next, number 2.
Atty Jazgar addresses the Court, addresses the theories in the JD file.
Atty Kaiser addresses the Court, replies.
Atty Jazgar addresses the Court, replies, is at a loss with the amount of discovery, does not have a list of witnesses yet.

Discussions continue.
Court will not rule on this motion today, will give counsel opportunity to respond.

-Motion for continuance is addressed
Atty Jazgar addresses the Court, is still plowing through the thumb drive.  Defendant has not had opportunity to review what is on the thumb drive. Defendant will be receiving all the discs within the next week.

8:43 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Atty Troy Nielsen has filed a Motion to Withdraw from this case.
Atty Nielsen makes a statement regarding his motion.
Court questions Atty Nielsen if he has spoken with his attorney regarding his request to withdraw.
Court questions the defendant.
Court indicates that the Jury Trial is scheduled for mid-July and would like to keep it at this time.
Court informs the defenant that there could be a possible delay in the Jury Trial if a new attorney requests this.
Atty Kaiser makes statements regarding the withdrawal of Atty Nielsen and indicates his concerns on the record.
Court informs the parties that his son works in the Attorney General's Office and is asking if any of the parties would like Judge Flugaur to
recuse himself and this information will be sent to all parties and the parties will need to determine if there should be a recusal.
Neither party has anything to add regarding the recusal or any other issues.
